title: PRESS DIGEST - Bulgaria - Oct 15
text:
SOFIA, Oct 15 (Reuters) - These are some of the main stories in Bulgarian newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- Bulgaria's government summoned the Security Council, its advisory security body, to discuss the escalation of the situation in Syria. Bulgaria, which has over 300 km land border with Turkey, is concerned about an eventual increase of refugee inflows. (Monitor, Trud, Sega, 24 Chasa, Duma)

SEGA - Bulgarian gas company Overgas said it plans to invest 79 million levs ($44.53 million) and build another 398 km of retail gas infrastructure over the next 5 years.

TRUD - The minimum monthly salary will be increased by 50 levs to 610 levs ($343.86), Labour Minister Biser Petkov said.

($1 = 1.7740 leva)
